activities:
Upwork (www.upwork.com) is the world’s largest and and fastest-growing online workplace, enabling businesses and contractors to work together without geographic limits.

By using technology to remove the barriers of traditional hiring, Upwork's platform aligns businesses’ talent needs with contractors’ desire to work when and where they want, on projects of their choosing. 

Upwork customers in the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland provide personal information to Upwork in the course of using the Upwork service.  Upwork uses that information to provide the Upwork service, as described on the Upwork website and in the Upwork Privacy Policy, as they may be amended from time to time.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: The personal information processed by Upwork is customer information.  Generally speaking, the data is machine processed, although it may be manually processed in exceptions cases, such as customer support, dispute resolution, or error analysis.
